page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: The majority of the houses in our area are pre-war, semi-detached, council houses. About 26% of the houses are owner occupied. Most houses are brick built with tiled roofs. Severn, Thames and Wye Road have steel houses and asbestos roofs, built just after the 2nd World War. The majority of the houses are 3 bedroomed. Modernization of the Council houses in this area has taken place over the last 8 years. 85% of the families have lived in their houses less than 15 years. Most houses have gas heating. The houses all have gardens. Most of them are partially lawned at least, 43% of the households grow some vegetables in their gardens. The total number of houses in the area is 2,345. Each year a number of Fairground Travellers settle for the winter on two sites in the area.
